SENT.plain: Complete dislocation of the lens is a rare feature of Marfan's Syndrome
We observed four cases of bilateral complete posterior dislocation of the lens in established cases of Marfan's Syndrome over a one year period
An ophthalmologist may encounter infrequently, unilateral posterior dislocation in one eye and ectopia lentis in the other, but bilateral spontaneous posterior dislocation is rare
All our cases had associated vitreous degeneration with vitreous herniating into the anterior chamber
The pathogenesis of complete posterior dislocation in Marfan's Syndrome is discussed
